intro: Ecbolium flagelliforme, commonly known as the whip plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, whip-like stems that can grow up to several meters in length. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellow in color. Its leaves are alternate and narrow, often covered in fine hairs. Ecbolium flagelliforme is native to tropical regions and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
